cessda: Consortium of European Social Science Data Archives

notAvailable.title: Not found
notAvailable.heading: The requested data was not found.
notAvailable.content: It may not exist or is not available in the selected language. Choose an alternative language or start a new search.
notAvailable.alternateLanguage: The study description is available in the following languages

search.placeholder: Enter search term in the selected language

tooltip.content: The catalogue contains study descriptions in various languages. The system searches with your search terms from study descriptions available in the language you have selected. The catalogue does not have ‘All languages’ option as due to linguistic differences this would give incomplete results. See the User Guide for more detailed information.
tooltip.ariaLabel: Tooltip button for search and search language

noHits.noResultsFound: No results found for "%(query)s" in the selected language.
noHits.error: We're sorry, an issue occurred when fetching your results. Please try again.

view.less: Keep only %(defaultSize)s most common %(name)s in searchable %(name)s list

tooltip.content: Topic terms serve to identify the general topics, subjects or themes of a study. Many but not all metadata providers use CESSDA Topic Classification for their topic terms.
Keywords which describe the content of the data. Many but not all metadata providers use ELSST Thesaurus for their keywords. Searchable list contains a maximum of %(size)s most common keywords.
The year(s) in which the data for the study were collected.
tooltip.ariaLabel: Tooltip button for Collection years filter

tooltip.content: Language of the research dataset, i.e. the language of the variable names/labels or interview transcriptions etc.
tooltip.ariaLabel: Tooltip button for language of data files

tooltip.content: The country which the data cover. Note: the filter only includes those studies where the metadata provide an ISO 3166-1 country code. Use an additional free-text search with country name for more results.
Language of study titles and abstract / description.
Name of the institution providing the information on the study.

summary.label: Filter summary
summary.introduction: The following filters have been applied to your search.
summary.remove: Select a filter to remove it from this search.
summary.noFilters: No additional filters have been applied to your search.

numberOfResults.zero: %(count)s studies found in %(label)s from a total of %(total)s
numberOfResults.one: %(count)s study found in %(label)s from a total of %(total)s
numberOfResults.other: %(count)s studies found in %(label)s from a total of %(total)s

advancedSearch.label: Search help
advancedSearch.introduction: The following special characters can be used to perform advanced search queries:
advancedSearch.phrase: " wraps a number of tokens to signify a phrase for searching.
advancedSearch.prefix: * at the end of a term signifies a prefix query.
advancedSearch.distance: ~N after a word signifies edit distance (fuzziness).
advancedSearch.slop: ~N after a phrase signifies slop amount.

escaping.heading: Escaping
escaping.content: The above characters are reserved. In order to search for any of these special characters, they will need to be escaped with \.

defaultOperator.heading: Default operator
defaultOperator.content: The default operator when there are no special characters in a given search term is OR. For example when searching for Social Science, this will be interpreted as Social OR Science.

tooltip.content: Terminology used is generally based on DDI controlled vocabularies: Time Method, Analysis Unit, Sampling Procedure and Mode of Collection, available at <a href="https://vocabularies.cessda.eu/">CESSDA Vocabulary Service<a/>.
Many but not all metadata providers use CESSDA Topic Classification for their topic terms.
Many but not all metadata providers use ELSST Thesaurus for their keywords.

about.label: About
about.content:
This is the CESSDA Data Catalogue (CDC) version 3.5.0 released on 2023-01-30. It contains descriptions of the more than 40,000 data collections held by CESSDA’s Service Providers (SPs), originating from over 20 European countries. The CDC is a one-stop shop for searching and discovering European social science data. The presented data includes a range of data types including quantitative, qualitative or mixed-modes data, covering both cross-sectional and longitudinal studies, as well as recently collected and historical data. The metadata (study descriptions) are presented in the language as originally provided by the organisations producing the metadata. Some publishers provide study descriptions both in English and in the local language, some only in either English or in the local language. Currently, about 75%% of study descriptions are available in English.

The User Guide presents an overview of how to use the data catalogue for searching, covering basic search operations, application of filters and advanced search functionalities.

The CDC is a portal for discovering data and detailed dataset descriptions are provided. For information and procedures on how to access data, there is a link [‘Access data’] from each study to the study information on the website of the data provider (Publisher). Refer to the information found there to see which access conditions apply to data created in the particular study.

There is also an OAI-PMH compliant endpoint, so that data aggregators can easily harvest the entire contents of the data catalogue. Record identifiers are unified with those used in the User Interface. It is located at https://datacatalogue.cessda.eu/oai-pmh/v0/oai.

There is also a search API. Documentation is available at the public REST APIs for CESSDA Services page.

Changes since the last version

  • Integration with ELSST

accessibility.label: Accessibility Statement for CESSDA Data Catalogue

heading.compatibility: Compatibility with browsers and assistive technology

content.opening: CESSDA is committed to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities. We are continually improving the user experience for everyone, and applying the relevant accessibility standards.
content.conformance: The Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) defines requirements for designers and developers to improve accessibility for people with disabilities. It defines three levels of conformance: Level A, Level AA, and Level AAA. CDC is partially conformant with WCAG 2.1 level AA. Partially conformant means that some parts of the content do not fully conform to the accessibility standard. The identified shortcomings in the accessibility of CDC are described below.

nonAccessible.paragraph: We acknowledge that despite our diligent efforts, some areas of our website may not be fully accessible. The primary reason for non-accessible content lies in the complexity of upgrading specific third-party libraries. The versions of these libraries do not allow for the necessary accessibility enhancements without substantial modifications, which would be a significant undertaking.
nonAccessible.list:
• Language select does not have ARIA relationship with select options (1.3.1 Info and Relationships)
  • Feedback form does not have autocomplete attributes (1.3.5 Identify Input Purpose)
  • Placeholder texts of search filters have low contrast (1.4.3 Contrast)
  • Applied filter options cannot be selected by keyboard (2.1.1: Keyboard)
  • Dropdown elements confirm selection on down-event (2.5.2: Pointer Cancellation)
  • Some metadata might not have lang attribute despite being different than default (en) (3.1.2: Language of Parts)
  • Labels missing from a few elements in third-party library components (4.1.2: Name, Role, Value)
  • Status messages are missing status roles (4.1.3: Status Messages)

content.feedback: For additional assistance or inquiries related to accessibility, please utilise our feedback form.
content.compatibility: CDC's accessibility features are currently undergoing testing primarily on Firefox and Chrome browsers. Screen reader mainly used in testing is NVDA. Other major browsers and screen readers should also be compatible but some aspects of the website may not display optimally, especially if using older versions.
content.assessment: CESSDA assessed the accessibility of CDC by self-evaluation.
content.about: The accessibility statement was first created on August 23rd 2023.

notFound.label: Page Not Found
notFound.content: The page you are trying to access cannot be found.
